title: I'm writing a novel. It's only 13000 words. Is that enough for a middle grade fiction? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi What you are writing falls in the category of a novelette, as per the suggested word count. Word count - Wikipedia I’d also suggest going through Hugo Award for Best Novelette - Wikipedia to get an idea about the value of novelettes. So yes, it is sufficient to satisfy the criteria of a novelette, but not that of a novel. Here’s another bit, which shares advice on minimum wordcount for a novel Word count by genre: How long should my book really be? My personal take is, just to be on the right side of the fence, a novel should be over 70–75,000 words. Good Luck ! :)
